context: Raleigh Island is an old red fishing hole I have fished at for 40 years. It is at the entrance of Preachers Hole. The redfish migrate to Preachers Hole during the winter and hang out there until the water starts to warm. We launch our boat at Shell Mound. This article mentions mounds. There are several large mounds twenty to thirty feet high of oyster shells. We always were told it was where the indians buried their dead on top of each other. The area is right next to Cedar Key in Levy County. Lots of history in that area.
These village people were down south because of all the glaciers in Canada and North U.S. where is was just too cold to live [for some].  Heat good, cold bad.
Why they use the term Pre Columbian when it pertains to the US is beyond me. Columbus never set foot, here.
